intro: Phaca douglasii, commonly known as Douglas's phaca, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, rocky soils along streambanks and in woodland areas. Phaca douglasii is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
